info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 5:17PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Berks and northwestern Lehigh Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 517 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Snyders, or 7 miles southeast of Tamaqua, moving southwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hamburg, Leesport, Shoemakersville, Strausstown, Lenhartsville, Wanamakers, New Tripoli and Centerport. This includes Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 21 and 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Mount Holly NJ.
